{{Infobox Website |name = VDARE |logo = [[Image:vdare1.jpg|300px]] |screenshot = |caption = |url = [http://www.vdare.com VDARE.com] |commercial = |type = |language = |registration = |owner = VDARE Foundation |author = |launch date = |current status = |revenue = |slogan = }} '''''VDARE.com''''', or '''''VDARE''''', is a [[website]] that advocates [[immigration reduction|reduced immigration]], especially [[illegal immigration]], [[Immigration to the United States|into the United States]]. Former ''[[Forbes]]'' editor [[Peter Brimelow]] supports the site through his ''VDARE'' Foundation, also known as Lexington Research Institute Limited.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faqs.org/tax-exempt/CT/Lexington-Research-Institute-Limited.html |title=Lexington Research Institute Limited in Litchfield, Connecticut (CT) |publisher=faqs.org |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> The viewpoints on the site range from immigration reduction to anti-immigration to discussions of [[Race (classification of human beings)|race]].
The name ''VDARE'' and the site's [[symbol]], the head of a white [[deer|doe]], refer to [[Virginia Dare]], the first child born to [[England|English]] settlers in the [[New World]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/why_vdare.htm |title=Why VDARE.COM / The White Doe? |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> Soon after her birth she disappeared with the rest of the early English settlement of [[Roanoke Colony|Roanoke]], and legend says she transformed into a white doe.
The [[Southern Poverty Law Center]] has [[List of organizations designated by the Southern Poverty Law Center as hate groups|designated]] VDARE as a white nationalist [[hate group]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.splcenter.org/get-informed/intelligence-files/groups |title=Groups |publisher=Splcenter.org |date= |accessdate=2012-09-08}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.splcenter.org/vdare-foundation |title=VDARE |publisher=Splcenter.org |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref>
==Contributors== *[[Peter Brimelow]], founder of ''VDARE'' and a former editor at [[Forbes]] and [[National Review]] *"Athena Kerry", a pseudonym for Brimelow's wife, Lydia Sullivan. Sullivan graduated from Loyola University Chicago with degrees in Philosophy and English. *[[Steve Sailer]], a writer and movie critic for [[Taki's Magazine]], known for his controversial articles on race, human biology, and gender issues. * Allan Wall, a teacher who lived in [[Mexico]] from 1991 through 2008 (except for a tour in [[Iraq War|Iraq]] with the [[Texas Army National Guard|Texas National Guard]]) before moving to [[Oklahoma]], who writes primarily about Mexican culture and politics, especially as it relates to immigration from Mexico to the U.S. *[[Chilton Williamson]], an author and columnist who has written extensively about life in the American West *[[Samuel T. Francis|Sam Francis]] was a regular contributor until his death in 2005. *[[Scott McConnell]], a former contributor *Brenda Walker, California-based environmentalist and feminist turned anti-immigration blogger *Edwin Rubenstein, economist
Notable ''VDARE'' guest contributors include: [[Virginia Abernethy]], [[George J. Borjas]],<ref>[http://www.vdare.com/misc/borjas_heaven_door.htm HEAVEN’S DOOR AFTER A YEAR - George J. Borjas<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Paul Gottfried]], [[Kevin Michael Grace]], [[Kevin B. MacDonald]], [[J. Philippe Rushton]], [[Jared Taylor]], [[John Derbyshire]], [[Paul Belien]], [[Sean Gabb]], [[Robert Weissberg]], [[R. J. Stove]], [[Derek Turner (journalist)|Derek Turner]], [[Kevin Lamb]], [[Drew Fraser|Andrew Fraser]], and [[Ilana Mercer]].
''VDARE'' also carries the [[print syndication|syndicated]] columns of [[Pat Buchanan]], <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/buchanan/index.htm |title=Patrick J. Buchanan Articles |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> [[Paul Craig Roberts]], <ref>[http://www.vdare.com/users/paul-craig-roberts/ Archive of Paul Craig Roberts Articles at VDare.com] Retrieved August 2, 2012.</ref> and [[Michelle Malkin]]. <ref>[http://www.vdare.com/users/michelle-malkin/ Archive of Michelle Malkin Articles at VDare.com] Retrieved August 2, 2012.</ref>
==Controversy and criticism== The [[Southern Poverty Law Center]] (SPLC) called ''VDARE'' a [[hate group]],<ref>[http://www.splcenter.org/get-informed/intelligence-files/groups/ VDARE] Retrieved August 2, 2012.</ref> that was "once a relatively mainstream anti-immigration page," but by 2003 became "a meeting place for many on the radical right." The group also criticized ''VDARE'' for publishing articles by white nationalists [[Jared Taylor]] and [[Samuel T. Francis|Sam Francis]].<ref>{{cite web|author=<!--paging_filter-->By Heidi Beirich and Mark Potok |url=http://www.splcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?pid=286 |title='Paleoconservatives' Decry Immigration | Southern Poverty Law Center |publisher=Splcenter.org |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> It has been called "[[white nationalist]]" by the ''[[Rocky Mountain News]]'',<ref>{{cite news|title=Funding questioned ; Critics say some Defend Colorado money tainted|first=Kevin |last=Flynn|work=Rocky Mountain News|location=Denver, Colo.|date=Jul 15, 2006|page=4.A}}</ref> a charge denied by Brimelow.<ref>{{cite news|title=VDare.com is no 'white nationalist Web site'|first=Peter |last=Brimelow|work=Rocky Mountain News|date=July 23, 2006|page=5.E}}</ref>
In response, ''VDARE'' has published several articles attacking the SPLC.<ref name="vdare.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/fulford/southern_poverty_center.htm |title=05/30/01 - VDARE Endorsed by Southern Poverty Law Center! (Well, we regard it as an endorsement.) |publisher=Vdare.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/pb/050423_speech.htm |title=04/23/05 - The Speech That Launched An SPLC “Hate” Honor |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> In 2006, in "Heidi Does Long Beach: The SPLC vs. Academic Freedom," Prof. [[Kevin B. MacDonald]] discussed the SPLC's so far unsuccessful campaign to try to get him fired from [[California State University, Long Beach]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/macdonald/061114_splc.htm |title=11/14/06 - Heidi Does Long Beach: The SPLC vs. Academic Freedom |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref>
''VDARE'' columnist James Fulford says allegations of racism and hate are unavoidable since "the majority of Americans are white, and the majority of immigrants are non-white."<ref name="vdare.com"/> Fulford lists others who he says have been accused of being racist by liberal organizations and argues that the group's tactics hurt their own cause more than they are hurting genuine racism.
On September 5, 2003, ''VDARE'' contributor Thomas Allen commented in an online letter that VDARE.COM has carried articles "by Hispanics like George Borjas, American Indians, Filipina Americans, Japanese Americans etc."<ref name="ReferenceA">{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/letters/tl_090503.htm |title=A VDARE.COM Contributor Worries About Smears; Peter Brimelow Reassures Him |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref>
===Hurricane Katrina and IQ=== [[Steve Sailer]] argued on ''VDARE'' following [[Hurricane Katrina]] that the lower average [[IQ]] of [[African-Americans]] found in intelligence research correlates with "poorer native judgment than members of better-educated groups resulting in the need for stricter moral guidance from society." He said that looting after the [[1995 Kobe earthquake]] was minimal because "when you get down to it, Japanese aren't blacks."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/sailer/050903_new_orleans.htm |title=09/03/05 - Racial Reality And The New Orleans Nightmare |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref>
[[John Podhoretz]] called Sailer's comments racist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://corner.nationalreview.com/post/?q=NTIyMThlNmMzNThiZjM4MjQzODUzM2JlZTIzMWJhYjA |title=The Corner on National Review Online |publisher=Corner.nationalreview.com |date=2005-09-05 |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> Sailer responded that his accusers admitted a correlation between low IQ and poor judgment by supporting the [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court's]] 2002 ''[[Atkins v. Virginia]]'' decision "that, in effect, banned the death penalty for killers with [[Intelligence quotient#Mental retardation|IQs under 70]]."<ref>{{cite web|last=Sailer |first=Steve |url=http://isteve.blogspot.com/2005/09/supreme-court-on-iq-and-judgment.html |title=Steve Sailer's iSteve Blog: The Supreme Court on IQ and Judgment |publisher=Isteve.blogspot.com |date=2005-09-06 |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> [[John Derbyshire]] defended Sailer, citing large variance in [[Race and crime in the United States#Prison data|incarceration rates by race]] and birth rates for unmarried women by race.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://web.archive.org/web/20051013082930/http://corner.nationalreview.com/05_09_04_corner-archive.asp#075519 |title=Internet Archive Wayback Machine |publisher=Web.archive.org |date=2005-10-13 |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref>
According to [[Peter Brimelow]], Sailer's original article has been emailed out by readers (through the link to "email [this article] to a friend") at among the highest volumes seen by VDARE's articles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.vdare.com/archives/2005/09/05/sailer-vs-jpod-on-no-nightmare/ |title=VDARE.com: Blog Articles » Sailer vs. JPod on NO Nightmare |publisher=Blog.vdare.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> Sailer also responded to John Podhoretz in "Podhoretz, Junior vs. Steve Sailer",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/sailer/050717_podhoretz.htm |title=07/17/05 - Podhoretz, Junior vs. Steve Sailer |publisher=VDARE.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-22}}</ref> by quoting from a 1963 ''Commentary'' essay by Podhoretz's father, [[Norman Podhoretz|Norman]], "My Negro Problem—and Ours",<ref>http://www.lukeford.net/Images/photos/out.pdf</ref> in which Norman Podhoretz made statements on black violence in character with Sailer's.
